title: Trip from Mesa(AZ) to Dubuque(IA)
name: Trip from Mesa(AZ) to Dubuque(IA)
description:
A Map by Zonie

This is a map of the route that the wife and I took on our move from Mesa, Arizona to Dubuque, Iowa.

properties.name: A Main Street Town
properties.description: Posted by ZonieBecause some of my family hails from here, the wife and I decided to take a little trip down Main Street here. A quaint little town it is.

properties.name: Albuquerque
properties.description: Posted by Zonie

properties.name: At least it had a bed
properties.description: Posted by ZonieAll I can say is that at least it was a bed to sleep in for our first night on the road.

properties.name: Close Encounter II
properties.description: Posted by ZonieIt was off in this straight stretch of I-40 that the wife and I had our second "close call" with wildlife (the first being the antelope that we almost creamed in the Painted Desert in Arizona). Hitting wildlife with a huge moving truck is not something that I would advise. Having a wife in the passenger seat get freaked out at looking a deer in the eyes is also something that I would not advise, but I would take the latter over the former. Also along this stretch, the wife and I discovered a new meaning to the Garth Brooks song, "The Thunder Rolls" as we watched a thunderstorm in the far distance cross the highway.

properties.name: Cross of the Plains
properties.description: Posted by ZonieWhat can I say but, "Wow!" Driving along Interstate 40, I could see this from about 12 miles away. If you are passing through the Texas Panhandle, this is a must stop. BTW, if you look at the satellite image on the map above, you can tell that this is a huge object (you can zoom in quite a ways)

properties.name: Historic Gallup
properties.description: Posted by ZonieGallup is an interesting Route 66 town. Somewhat stuck in the past and still trying to get to the future, it is worth a cruise down main street.

properties.name: Hohokam Park - Spring Training home of the Chicago Cubs
properties.description: Posted by ZonieAs a Cubs fan, I naturally have to include this in our map. Each spring, the Chicago Cubs travel to the desert to training. Not that it appears to help any but at least it gives all the Arizonies something to root for.

properties.name: Into Oklahoma
properties.description: Posted by ZonieIt was amazing that as we crossed into Oklahoma from Texas the ground changed color from the sandy color we had in Texas to the deep red that we came across in Oklahoma.

properties.name: Our Second Night on the Road
properties.description: Posted by ZonieOur second night on the road we spent at the Travelodge just off of I-40 in Amarillo, TX. Again, at least it was a warm bed and was clean.

properties.name: Our old home
properties.description: Posted by Zonie205 W McKellips Rd, Mesa, ArizonaThis is where we moved from. McKellips Manor Apartments is a little 30 unit apartment complex with a pool.

properties.name: The Painted Desert
properties.description: Posted by ZonieEven though we went through here at night, I have been here many times during the day and I can tell you from experience that this area - though barren and pretty flat - is a masterpiece from God. The sands are different shades of whites, reds, pinks, peach, orange and yellows. The highway that runs through here (US 191) used to carry the designation of US 666 and was referred to as the Devil\'s Highway for obvious reasons. When traveling through here, keep a lookout for antelope that range through here. Also, keep an eye on your speedometer as it is often easy to find yourself traveling much faster than you think.

properties.name: The cool pines
properties.description: Posted by ZonieJust a short hour and one half drive north of the Phoenix area is the great and cool little town of Payson. Zane Grey had a cabin a short bit from here that burned during the Dude fire in 1991. The cabin was rebuilt and dedicated in October 2005.
